root: ^Our school counselor asks me how a plane is different from a bird. What should I answer?
^A bird is alive, and a plane isn't
^A bird flaps its wings, and a plane doesn't
^A bird eats the feed, and the plane consumes the fuel
^A bird has a beak and talons, and a plane doesn't

res1: ^They told me I passed the test and don't have to visit the counselor up to the end of the term
^Our school counselor asked me how a plane was different from a bird. I said that a bird is alive, and a plane isn't. She seemed to like my answer.
res2: ^The school counselor was explaining something to Mom who looked quite shocked. What's wrong with me?
^Our school counselor asked me how a plane was different from a bird. I said that birds flap their wings, and planes don't. Looks like there's something wrong with me.
res3: ^They told me I would have to visit the counselor every month now. Fine, I have some questions to her, too, and not about planes!
^Our school counselor asked me how a plane was different from a bird. I said that birds eat the feed, and planes consume fuel. Now I have to visit the counselor every month!
res4: ^The counselor said she would need to observe me for a while. I think I'm just going to hide from her

^Our school counselor asked me how a plane was different from a bird. I said that a bird has a beak and talons, and a plane doesn't. Now, she wants to observe me for a while, but I'm going to hide from her.
